org.jpac

Class CyclicBuffer<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpac.CyclicBuffer<T>

  • public class CyclicBuffer<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    used to synchronize two threads having a producer - consumer relation the data objects stored inside the buffer are recycled as far as possible

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CyclicBuffer(int length) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      used to clear the buffer
      T get()
      used to fetch the next item from the cyclic buffer on the consumer side
      boolean isEmpty()
      used to check, if the cyclic buffer is empty
      boolean isFull()
      used to check, if the cyclic buffer is full
      T occupy()
      returns the next free item inside the buffer to the producer.
      void put(T t)
      used to put a new item into the cyclic buffer.
      void release()
      used to release a data item, which has been fetched by calling get() (consumer)
      boolean waitUntilFilled(int timeout)
      blocks a calling thread, until the cyclic buffer contains new items
      boolean waitUntilFreed(int timeout)
      blocks a calling thread, until the cyclic buffer contains free items

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CyclicBuffer

        public CyclicBuffer(int length)

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        used to clear the buffer

      • occupy

        public T occupy()
         throws org.jpac.BufferFullException
        returns the next free item inside the buffer to the producer. The item stored inside the cyclic buffer is returned for recycling purposes. The item cannot be accessed by the consumer, until it is put() again by the producer.
        Returns:
        the item
        Throws:
        BufferFullException - - thrown, if the cyclic buffer is full

      • put

        public void put(T t)
         throws org.jpac.BufferFullException
        used to put a new item into the cyclic buffer. Called by the producer
        Parameters:
        t -
        Throws:
        BufferFullException

      • release

        public void release()
             throws org.jpac.BufferEmptyException
        used to release a data item, which has been fetched by calling get() (consumer)
        Throws:
        BufferEmptyException - thrown, if the buffer does not contain any item

      • get

        public T get()
      throws org.jpac.BufferEmptyException
        used to fetch the next item from the cyclic buffer on the consumer side
        Returns:
        the item
        Throws:
        BufferEmptyException - thrown, if the cyclic buffer does not contain at least one item

      • waitUntilFreed

        public boolean waitUntilFreed(int timeout)
        blocks a calling thread, until the cyclic buffer contains free items
        Parameters:
        timeout - maximum period of time to wait [ms]
        Returns:
        true, if a timeout occurred

      • waitUntilFilled

        public boolean waitUntilFilled(int timeout)
        blocks a calling thread, until the cyclic buffer contains new items
        Parameters:
        timeout - maximum period of time to wait [ms]
        Returns:
        true, if a timeout occurred

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        used to check, if the cyclic buffer is empty
        Returns:
        true: the buffer is empty

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        used to check, if the cyclic buffer is full
        Returns:
        true: the buffer is full
